mckay.utilities.staticlibraries

Class NetworkMethods

  • java.lang.Object
    • mckay.utilities.staticlibraries.NetworkMethods

  • public class NetworkMethods
extends java.lang.Object
    A holder class for static methods relating to strings.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      NetworkMethods() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void pipe(java.io.Reader reader, java.io.Writer writer)
      Pipes data from the specified reader to the specified writer via a buffer.
      static void postData(java.net.URL url_to_access, java.io.Reader to_send, java.io.Writer response_writer)
      Makes the equivalent of an HTTP POST request in order to post content to a server.
      static java.lang.String sendGetRequest(java.lang.String url_to_access, java.lang.String request_parameters)
      Makes the equivalent of an HTTP GET request in order to access content from a server.

    • Method Detail

      • sendGetRequest

        public static java.lang.String sendGetRequest(java.lang.String url_to_access,
                              java.lang.String request_parameters)
                                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Makes the equivalent of an HTTP GET request in order to access content from a server. Based on code by Aviran Mordo originally posted at www.aviransplace.com/2008/01/08/make-http-post-or-get-request-from-java/
        Parameters:
        url_to_access - The URL of the server to access. e.g. "http://www.google.com"
        request_parameters - The request parameters. Note that this adds the question mark to the request, so it should not be present here. No parameters are used if this string is null or empty. e.g. "param1=val1¶m2=val2"
        Returns:
        The response from the server. Null is returned if the specified url_to_access does not begin with "http://".
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Throws an exception if the get request was unsuccesful.

      • postData

        public static void postData(java.net.URL url_to_access,
            java.io.Reader to_send,
            java.io.Writer response_writer)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Makes the equivalent of an HTTP POST request in order to post content to a server. Based on code by Aviran Mordo originally posted at www.aviransplace.com/2008/01/08/make-http-post-or-get-request-from-java/
        Parameters:
        url_to_access - The URL of the server to access. e.g. "http://www.google.com"
        to_send - The data to send to post to the server.
        response_writer - Where to write the server's response to.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Throws an exception if the post request was unsuccesful.

      • pipe

        public static void pipe(java.io.Reader reader,
        java.io.Writer writer)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Pipes data from the specified reader to the specified writer via a buffer.
        Parameters:
        reader - The reader to pipe data from.
        writer - The writer to pipe data to.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
